recipes.title: Lentil Chocolate Truffles
recipes.instructions: In a small pot, combine lentils, water, coffee and vanilla. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat and cook over medium heat until the liquid is absorbed and lentils are tender, about 10-15 minutes.Transfer lentils to a food processor and process until completely smooth (*this is crucial for smooth truffles. Rub a small amount of the lentils between your fingers to test for smoothness).In another small pot, combine chocolate and cream and melt over low heat, stirring constantly, until chocolate is melted and smooth (be very careful not to overheat. If that is a concern, use a double boiler to melt the chocolate instead).Add chocolate to the lentils in the food processor and process until completely combined. Scrape into a bowl and refrigerate for 5-6 hours or overnight. Once the truffle mixture has set, roll into 1 balls (or desired size), and roll in your choice of coatings. Store in the refrigerator for 3-4 days or freeze for up to 1 month.
